text.more: A multipartite ego-centric graph of former Vice President Aaron Burr around the time of his infamous 1804 duel with long-time political rival Alexander Hamilton. Nodes on the graph represent people or organizations those in the network are affiliated with. Edges indicate a relationship, while the color connotes either a positive (green) or negative (reg) relationship. The color of the nodes represent party affiliation, with blue for Federalists, red for Democratic-Republicans, and white for unknown, unaffiliatied, or not applicable.
text.intro: A network of former Vice President Aaron Burr before his fated duel with Alexander Hamilton in 1804.
text.title: Aaron Burr's network (~1804)
